definitions.definition: To point or direct a missile, or a weapon which propels as missile, towards an object or spot with the intent of hitting it
examples: He aimed at the target, but the arrow flew straight over it.

definitions.definition: To direct the intention or purpose; to attempt the accomplishment of a purpose; to try to gain; to endeavor;—followed by at, or by an infinitive
examples: to aim to do well in life

definitions.definition: To direct or point (e.g. a weapon), at a particular object; to direct, as a missile, an act, or a proceeding, at, to, or against an object
examples: to aim an arrow at the deer
She aimed a punch at her ex-boyfriend.

definitions.definition: To direct (something verbal) towards a certain person, thing, or group
examples: to aim a satirical comment at Communists in general

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To point or direct a missile, or a weapon which propels as missile, towards an object or spot with the intent of hitting it
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To direct the intention or purpose; to attempt the accomplishment of a purpose; to try to gain; to endeavor;—followed by at, or by an infinitive
( transitive ) To direct or point (e.g. a weapon), at a particular object; to direct, as a missile, an act, or a proceeding, at, to, or against an object
( transitive ) To direct (something verbal) towards a certain person, thing, or group
( intransitive , obsolete ) To guess or conjecture .
